note.p: Education: AB (1757), AM (1760) Peterhouse College, Cambridge; MD (1777, St Andrew's); LCP (1777)
Career: Ordained; Lecturer in Theology, Cambridge University; resigned from Church of England and became a Unitarian; took up medicine
References: L B Glyn, 'Israel Lyons: a short but starry career. The life of an eighteenth-century Jewish botanist and astronomer' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 275-305
Notes: Munk gives birthplace as London
